Yes, I have it all. Feldsher told me what happened, so I went and picked up your stuff from Mervin's hiding place. I spotted that mystical nutcase hiding it.
That's good! Well, please return everything.
Yes of course, but there is just one more thing I need you to do, okay?

What... again! I have already searched the entire area on your whims, and now you ramble about another job in order for me to get my things back. It shouldn't be necessary! What the hell do I need to do now?

C'mon don't get angry it is a simple task. Find the Pripyat Theatre. There's a box of the dynamite there which belongs to the Mercenaries. Find it and bring it to me. I couldn't find the box myself, but you're an eagle-eyed man so I'm sure you will find it. Then I'll give your stuff back. Oh here take this suit, two F-1 hand grenades, an AK and some ammo.
Well I guess I have no choice, so I will do it.
I found the box of dynamite.
Good, give it here and take your stuff.
Here take the box of dynamite.
Hey Dan, do you need any help?

I have a very important mission. Sakharov gave it to me. I cannot get away and I have no one else to send, I'm in a predicament. We must find three laser discs with information that is of great value to the scientists. These discs have about five years of information stored on them. I not sure, but Sakharov said that they might hold old archival records. He read many years ago, that after the second explosion occurred and the violent eruption of Chernobyl, that a team of Military scientists accompanied by a detachment of Special Forces, was sent into the Zone. They were tasked to study the strange phenomenon that began immediately after the emission. This group had spent about three months in the restricted area when something happened and all communications with them was lost. About a week later, two Special Forces soldiers from the detachment of guards came, or rather crawled, to the checkpoint. They were in a terrible state, saying things unintelligible and improbable. They were found to be insane and were sent to a mental hospital. We immediately organized a search and rescue operation but no one else was found.
Are you talking about the first expedition to study the Zone?

Yes, the first expedition. So listen up. The two soldiers who escaped to the checkpoint soon died in a hospital from excessively high doses of radiation that they sustained in little over a week. One doctor who watched over them in the hospital wrote down everything in his diary whenever they spoke about their adventures. This doctor was a friend of Sakharov, and when he learned that he was going to work in the Zone gave, him his diary. Amongst other things, there was information those first scientists were conducting surveillance on a strange metamorphosis that was occurring in animals. Judging by the entries in the diary, under the supervision of scientific experts, they kept a few animal specimens in their laboratories: dogs, pigs and rats, which they kept in cages and were constantly being taken for analyses. These animals changed before their eyes. They mutated at a frantic pace and turned into horrible creatures.
Well, that's interesting. But where are the disks with this information?

Don't interrupt! The data reveals that within a month, after they began monitoring the mutants, there was an emergency. Somehow, the creatures managed to escape and they smashed and damaged the majority of the laboratory research equipment, including computers on which all the archives of the studies were stored. Three guards and a scientist were bitten. Two of the dogs were shot, the rest fled into the woods near the camp. So, then it was decided to minimize the work and return immediately, as to delay and wait for help to arrive was too dangerous. All test results and observations that were made seemed to have been lost, but it turned out that one of the scientists, the day before the tragedy, recorded all data on three laser discs. Two Special Forces guys were assigned to take these discs, as soon as possible, and deliver them to the 'Mainland'. The remaining members of the group planned to gather the rest of the equipment, and leave the camp and move out a day after them. But as we now know, none of the others survived. And those two on the road were attacked by the mutants. Fleeing, they had to dump all their gear, including the backpack that contained their provisions and the laser disks.
These are the facts! Where do I find a rucksack with the three disks lost five years ago? And by the way, why is this five year old information so important now?

Those findings - they are priceless, as they should disclose the secret and the root cause of mutations of living organisms in the Zone, as performed at the earliest stages, immediately after the release in 2006. Finding the disks will be not easy, but possible. The backpack will be somewhat decayed and mutants hunting for food have probably got into it, but the disks are in special high-strength plastic cases. Animals don't eat plastic, so if someone from the Stalker community found them long ago, we would have known. The place where Special Forces lost the backpack, is described as similar to the territory which we now call the Garbage. As a reference, you should find it somewhere in the ravines of the Garbage heap. Well, will you try to find those three discs? I will be indebted to you.
Okay, I will try to help.
Hi, Dan! Well, I found the bloody discs.
That's great! All three?
Yes, all three. Oh, and I had to climb up a ravine in the Garbage to get them. Filthy place.
Needless to say, here, take this reward, a 'SKS rifle' and a couple of packs of cartridges for it..
A good rifle I cannot refuse, thanks! Here are your three laser discs..
Greetings Lecturer. Tutsan said that you have a deal for me.
Yes, I have something interesting for you. You're a Stalker, surely you've heard that there is a place where you can find real 'Klondike' artifacts. But you probably not believe it, right?
Yeah, I've heard something like that. There was talk of such a place, but it's a little hard to believe.
Believe me, this place really exists, and it does have rare 'Klondike' artifacts. To find these is a must. I can tell you how to find this unique artifacts and maybe a secret. Do you wish to know?
I don't reject such offers. However, what do you want in return.
In return for this information, bring me a Heart of the Controller artifact. Get one, and I'll reveal to you a secret I know.
Okay, I will bring you a Heart of the Controller.
Here, I've brought you a Heart of the Controller artefact. Now tell me the secret on how to find these unique artifacts.

You're smart boy! Well, listen here: the place, as you probably heard by hearsay, is in the Dark Valley, near the X-18 Laboratory complex. There is a depression over the hill, and here, you will find the 'Klondike'. Not everyone is destined to find the artifacts there, because you need to carry something with you.
And what is that?

It's necessary that you have an artifact called Snake Eyes. It's a catalyst for that place. Actually, that's how they all began. Specifically Snake Eyes was in a place where several anomalies and unprecedented transmutations were formed. To find this artifact is very difficult. I had one... But I gave it to one of the Lads called Walnut, in exchange for medicines he brought me. Well, I know where you can still find one such artifact, and then you can open the 'Magic Valley'.
Quickly, tell me more.

Don't be impatient! Well, listen here, you can find it in the forest at the Radar. It's next to a small gap in a barbed wire fence between two boulders. Find the Snake Eyes and then go to the Dark Valley. Seek low ground and collect treasured artifacts. Understand?
Yes everything is clear. Thanks for the valuable information. I will go look for the Snake Eyes in the forest at the Radar.
Greetings! Sviblov said you can tell me about a curious little thing.
And good health to you, Stalker. What thing, show me?
Here look, an amulet or something.
Very rare thing, I tell you, and very valuable. I even know what it is and what it's for.
Well spit it out, briefly.

So this: This is one of the six ancient magical amulets. I saw a similar one on an old digger had in Pripyat. He then told me the story of these amulets. In short, as I said, only six of these exist, the one that you have, it's an Amulet of the first order, and one that I saw on a Digger was the Amulet of the third order. The Digger was a cunning peasant, and with young Stalkers, he was hunting for all sorts of unusual and rare stuff and any riddles of the Zone. Now he is currently searching the entire Zone for these amulets. He showed me one amulet and figures there are more, based on an ancient book. If I find any he promised to pay well. How these ancient heathen amulets ended up in the Zone, he did not say ...
Well, well, interesting, and why are these amulets so valuable?

Each by itself has not much value, but all six together do. They can catalyse the process of the six amulets becoming an Amulet Charm, which doubles their combined protective properties and in addition adds something else, and yet absolutely not radioactive. The five ordinal amulets have different protective properties, while the sixth is just a catalyst that sets in motion the ancient magic. In short, if you collect all six ordinal amulets, you get a unique protection Amulet, hanging it on the belt the owner will get very high protection from damage of various kinds.
Well, this mystic nonsense is a little hard to believe.

Try to find all six and check, I see you're a little doubtful but interested. Especially since the Digger went up to Pripyat, they say, he has recently died under mysterious circumstances, exactly where, I don't know, but they indicate that the last time he was seen, was somewhere in the centre of Pripyat, so there are no more secret areas to scout. See if you can find out what happened to him. The amulet should be on him. People said that one of his team mates had found another amulet, but he too, poor fellow, vanished somewhere in Yantar, in the underground catacombs of the X-16 laboratory. Maybe he was running from a monster or something. Another owner of an amulet is rumoured to have been dishonest. He offered his services to search for rare artifacts. He took an advance payments from Stalkers, and often didn't do the work. He was then set up: ordered to bring something from the bloodsucker's village and was given a specifically damaged AK, with a weak barrel that split after five rounds. That's where he perished, he could not fight off the vampires, the weapon broke into pieces, and they say he was a brave man. So perhaps in the village at the Military Warehouses, and is yet another amulet. The place is uninhabited, so there is a chance finding it. Where to look for the other amulets, I don't know. In short, good luck, Strelok! But I will put the information of all six amulets on your PDA, just in case.
You intrigue me! Thanks for the valuable information. Now I will not rest until I gather all six Amulets.
Pathfinder?! What are you doing here?
Doctor sent me to protect you. I made my way to Chernobyl NPP from the north through Limansk, there is a Secret Path there.
Glad to see you, buddy! What now?
Someone has blocked the entrance to the bunker with an explosion. Now there is no easy way to get in. But there is another option.
What, tell me.

Well, you know about my ability to open Secret Paths. Solomon gave me an Explorer artifact, he found it long ago in the Sarcophagus. The Explorer is quite old, but nevertheless it shows that the transition from the Sarcophagus to the Control Bunker is still running, but the way back is gone. I'll put a marker on your PDA. You've got to hurry up. Go back to the Sarcophagus Strelok, find the entrance to the Control Bunker. I can't go with you because the Secret Path can take only one, so I'll wait here. I hope you will be able to open the inside passage to the Control Bunker. Then together we'll see what's what. Oh, ah, don't forget to talk to Yuri Semetsky, he is in the Sarcophagus room.
Understood! I'll go to the Sarcophagus and you'll wait here.
